senses.sense_definition: A northern English and Scottish surname originating as a patronymic.

examples.text: Mr. <w>Watson</w> has been teaching history at our school for over twenty years.
The famous detective relied heavily on his friend, Dr. <w>Watson</w>, for support.

senses.sense_definition: A name used for various places in Australia, Canada, and the United States.

examples.text: They stopped in the small town of <w>Watson</w> to refuel their car.
The suburb of <w>Watson</w> offers many parks and recreational areas for families.

senses.sense_definition: Any character in a mystery story who serves as a foil or assistant to the detective, helping to reveal facts without solving the case immediately.

examples.text: Every brilliant fictional detective needs a <w>Watson</w> to explain the clues to the audience.
She played the role of <w>Watson</w>, asking the questions that allowed the genius to show off his deduction skills.
